text: Fulton is a city in Bourbon County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 165 people lived there. ==History== Fulton was first known as Osaga, and it was created as Osaga in 1869. The name changed to Fulton in 1878, after the city of Fulton, Illinois. A post office was created under the name Osaga in 1869. ==Geography== Fulton is at (38.009842, -94.719734), along the Little Osage River. The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== In 2020, there were 165 people, 51 households, and 32 families living in the city. The population density was . 79.4% of the people were White, 1.2% were African American, 0.6% were Native American, 4.8% were from other races, and 13.9% were from two or more races. 12.1% of the people were Hispanic or Latino of any race. ===2010 census=== In 2010, there were 163 people, 63 households, and 45 families residing in the city. The population density was . 90.2% of the people were White, 3.7% were Native American, 0.6% were African American, 1.2% were from other races, and 4.3% were from two or more races. 5.5% of the people were Hispanic or Latino of any race. ===2000 census=== In 2000, there were 184 people, 71 households, and 47 families residing in the city. The population density was 975.4 people per square mile (373.9/kmÂ²). 94.57% of the people were White, 3.26% were Native American, 0.54% were Asian, and 1.63% were from two or more races. 0.54% of the people were Hispanic or Latino of any race. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Fulton - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 234, local school district ;Maps * Fulton City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Bourbon County, Kansas Category:1869 establishments in Kansas
title: Fulton, Kansas
